text: humm anniversa learn stories across
culture and across time oh it's pretty
amazing today means you could get the
time machine and travel anywhere in
human history or and you could travel
across borders across cultures across
historical eras you'd go there and you'd
find the same amazing thing that their
stories are just like ours there'd be
cultural variations of course but for
the most part you'd find that story is
for them as it is for us it's about
characters facing problems striving to
overcome them the same kind of
obsessions the same kind of structures
and it's it emerges naturally in
children it blooms naturally in
children's one thing that feels kind of
weird the science of story it seems like
a paradox and oxymoron but it's not
science of storytelling fiction is as
natural to human beings as opposable
thumbs up great posture and to make
progress and understanding it science
really needs to be more in on this game
than it is currently
